      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addItemInOrder​(int tableId, MenuItem menuItem)
      Adds a MenuItem to the Order assigned to tableId.

      Used internally to destroy orders recorded inside OrderManager.

      Send the Order to be archived in ReportManager.

      Dumps state to disk.
      This will overwrite the existing .ser state file.

      Find the Order for the given tableId.
      Order[] getOrders()
      Gets an array of all currently-open Orders.
      private boolean isValidTableId​(int tableId)
      Checks whether given tableId is within the index range of the internal Order[] storage.
      void newOrder​(java.util.ArrayList<MenuItem> menuItems, java.lang.String staffName, int staffId, int tableId)
      Creates a new Order and stores it inside this OrderManager.
      void printInvoice​(int tableId)
      Prints the invoice of the Order for the given tableId.
      void removeItemInOrder​(int tableId, MenuItem menuItem)
      Removes a MenuItem from the Order assigned to tableId.
      private void reportFailedFileOp​(java.lang.String action, java.lang.Exception ex)
      Helper that reports a failed IO operation to stdout.
      private void restoreFromFile()
      Reads state from existing .ser file on disk.
      Warning: Will merge into, and overwrite, conflicting Order elements inside this.orders (if any) based on the Order[] that was serialized to disk.
      private int tableIdToIdx​(int tableId)
      Converts the given tableId to the index position of its corresponding Order in the internal Order[] storage.
      This is intended to create separation between the two similar values, and avoid off-by-one errors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrderManager

        public OrderManager​(ReportManager repMgr,
                    TableManager tableMgr)
        Constructor for the TableManager "singleton".
        Parameters:
        repMgr - The ReportManager instance. An internal reference to this will be stored.
        tableMgr - The TableManager instance. An internal reference to this will be stored.

    • Method Detail

      • tableIdToIdx

        private int tableIdToIdx​(int tableId)
        Converts the given tableId to the index position of its corresponding Order in the internal Order[] storage.
        This is intended to create separation between the two similar values, and avoid off-by-one errors.
        Parameters:
        tableId -
        Returns:
        Internal index position of the Order associated with the given tableId.

      • getOrders

        public Order[] getOrders()
        Gets an array of all currently-open Orders.
        Returns:
        Order[]

      • isValidTableId

        private boolean isValidTableId​(int tableId)
        Checks whether given tableId is within the index range of the internal Order[] storage.
        Parameters:
        tableId -
        Returns:
        Whether the given tableId is within index range of this.orders.

      • getOrderByTableId

        public Order getOrderByTableId​(int tableId)
        Find the Order for the given tableId.
        Parameters:
        tableId -

      • clearOrderByTableId

        private void clearOrderByTableId​(int tableId)
        Used internally to destroy orders recorded inside OrderManager. Used when customer makes payment, after Order object is transferred to the ReportManager.
        This method triggers a state dump to disk.
        Parameters:
        tableId -
        See Also:
        dumpToFile()

      • newOrder

        public void newOrder​(java.util.ArrayList<MenuItem> menuItems,
                     java.lang.String staffName,
                     int staffId,
                     int tableId)
        Creates a new Order and stores it inside this OrderManager.
        This method triggers a state dump to disk.
        Parameters:
        menuItems - ArrayList of MenuItems to add to the order initially.
        staffName - Name of the staff member creating the new Order.
        staffId - Staff ID of the staff member creating the new Order. Alphanumeric.
        tableId - tableId of the Table for the new Order.
        See Also:
        dumpToFile()

      • addItemInOrder

        public void addItemInOrder​(int tableId,
                           MenuItem menuItem)
        Adds a MenuItem to the Order assigned to tableId.
        This method triggers a state dump to disk.
        Parameters:
        tableId - The tableId of the Order
        menuItem - The MenuItem to remove from the Order
        See Also:
        dumpToFile()

      • removeItemInOrder

        public void removeItemInOrder​(int tableId,
                              MenuItem menuItem)
        Removes a MenuItem from the Order assigned to tableId.
        This method triggers a state dump to disk.
        Parameters:
        tableId - The tableId of the Order
        menuItem - The MenuItem to remove from the Order
        See Also:
        dumpToFile()

      • printInvoice

        public void printInvoice​(int tableId)
        Prints the invoice of the Order for the given tableId.
        Parameters:
        tableId -

      • closeOrder

        public boolean closeOrder​(int tableId)
        Send the Order to be archived in ReportManager. If ReportManager successfully archives the Order, the local reference to that Order will be deleted. Otherwise, if the archiving fails, OrderManager will not delete Order reference. Once the Order reference is deleted, OrderManager will no longer be able to access that Order.
        This method triggers a state dump to disk.
        Parameters:
        tableId -
        See Also:
        dumpToFile()

      • reportFailedFileOp

        private void reportFailedFileOp​(java.lang.String action,
                                java.lang.Exception ex)
        Helper that reports a failed IO operation to stdout.
        Parameters:
        action - A verb that fits the phrase "unable to ______"
        ex - The Exception object that was thrown

      • restoreFromFile

        private void restoreFromFile()
        Reads state from existing .ser file on disk.
        Warning: Will merge into, and overwrite, conflicting Order elements inside this.orders (if any) based on the Order[] that was serialized to disk.
        This will not delete any existing non-conflicting Order elements in this.orders.
        See Also:
        dumpToFile()

      • dumpToFile

        public void dumpToFile()
        Dumps state to disk.
        This will overwrite the existing .ser state file.
        See Also:
        restoreFromFile()
